glossary.tobacco_products: Any product containing tobacco or nicotine: cigars, cigarettes, hookah, chewing tobacco, pipe tobacco, rolling tobacco, vape oils/cartridges, e-cigarettes, vape pens, ENDS products, cessation products.
glossary.ends: Electronic Nicotine Delivery Systems - battery-powered devices for smoking/vaping flavored solutions with or without nicotine. Includes e-cigarettes, vape pens, vaporizers.
glossary.wellness_vapes: E-cigarette devices delivering vitamins (B-12, C, melatonin, caffeine, green tea) directly into lungs, tobacco and nicotine free.
glossary.products_simulating_smoking: E-cigarettes, vapes, and all products that simulate smoking regardless of tobacco/nicotine content.
glossary.tobacco_consumption: Subject (real, cartoon, or animated) consuming smoking product in/on mouth. Smoke may or may not be emanating. Holding in hands only is NOT consumption.
glossary.tobacco_paraphernalia: Hookah, bongs, tobacco pipes, rolling paper, cigarette filters, water pipes (with tobacco context), e-cigarette batteries/chargers, e-liquids, cigar cutters, cigarette rollers, ashtrays, lighters (if explicitly for smoking).
glossary.tobacco_cessation_fda_who: FDA/WHO approved cessation products: Gum (2mg, 4mg), Lozenges (2mg, 4mg), Transdermal Patches (7-30mg), Oral Mouth Spray (1mg per actuation), Nasal Spray (10mg/ml Rx), Oral Inhaler (10mg/ml Rx).
glossary.alcohol_products: Products containing alcohol intended for consumption: beer, wine, alcoholic cider, spirits (vodka, whiskey, etc.).
glossary.not_alcohol_products: Fermented drinks with minimal alcohol (kombucha, ginger beer), candies/foods/baked goods containing alcohol (rum cakes, chocolate with rum).
glossary.alcohol_consumption: Visual signals of someone (real or animated) drinking alcoholic beverage, or words encouraging/offering drinking. Subject has beverage on lips/mouth, drinking from bottle/can/cup/glass. Holding only is NOT consumption.
glossary.alcohol_brand_depiction: Obvious or intentional mention/depiction of alcohol brand - logo by itself or on labels/bottles/cups/cans/packaging. Must be fully visible, not blurry or partially obscured.
glossary.alcohol_event: Planned occasion organized primarily for drinking: happy hours, tastings/tours, booze cruises, beer pong, bar crawl. Does NOT include events where alcohol is offered but other activities present (paint & sip, concerts, fairs).
glossary.alcohol_venue: Physical location where primary activity is drinking or making alcoholic beverages: vineyards, cocktail bars, distilleries, bars, pubs.
glossary.incidental_alcohol: Secondary, non-prominent alcohol presence not tied to consumption: background depictions, environmental context (wine racks, unopened bottles), people holding drinks at party without active consumption.
glossary.primary_focus: For events: event itself is for selling/consuming alcohol. For consumption: real-world person actively drinking is the main subject.
glossary.brick_and_mortar: Legitimate business (physical or e-commerce), government entity, or non-profit. Signals: professional website link, physical location with hours/address/storefront, verified account, business identification.
glossary.peer_to_peer: Individual (not business) selling directly to another individual online. Signals: lack of business name/logo, informal language/slang, personal pronouns, specific meetup spots, phrases like 'DM me', 'OBO', 'hmu'.
glossary.fictional_content: Content created from imagination: movies, television shows, cartoons, video games, comic books, music videos, song lyrics.
glossary.documentary: Non-fictional content documenting reality for instruction, education, or historical record.
glossary.promote: Speaking positively, encouraging use, providing information/instructions, providing information on how to obtain.
glossary.coordinate: Any attempt to organize the flow of goods.

brickAndMortarIndicators: Link to professional website (not social media/blog)
Location pin specific to business premises
Customer check-ins specific to business premises
Page/Profile identifies as business (retail store, liquor store, brewery, e-cigarette store, tobacco store)
peerToPeerSignals: Lack of clear business name or logo
Use of informal language or slang
Specific location or meetup spot (pick up at my house)
Phrases: DM me, OBO, or best offer, lmk, hmu, hit me up

operationalGuidelines.hierarchy: If multiple signals present, select label highest in tree hierarchy
operationalGuidelines.5_second_rule: Video consumption: 5+ consecutive seconds = Label, <5 seconds = lower severity or no action (fictional)
operationalGuidelines.unknown_bnm_p2p: If cannot identify brick-and-mortar or peer-to-peer signals, default to Peer-to-Peer
operationalGuidelines.call_to_action_only: If only see CTA signals but no other BnM indicators, still select Brick-and-Mortar
operationalGuidelines.uncertain_5_seconds: If cannot confidently determine if <5 seconds, treat as 5+ seconds
operationalGuidelines.no_dosage_cessation: Cessation products without visible dosage = Not FDA/WHO approved
operationalGuidelines.uncertain_fictional: Use Google search to verify if content is from movie/TV/music video
operationalGuidelines.brand_uncertain: If uncertain between depiction vs promotion, treat as depiction (for alcohol) or promotion (for tobacco)
operationalGuidelines.partial_brand: If brand partially obscured/blurry/no search results, do NOT label as brand depiction
operationalGuidelines.image_sequence_video: Video containing only images (slideshow) = apply still imagery guidance, not 5-second rule
